section.title: Configuring Horizon for Keystone v3
section.para: Horizon does not support Keystone v3 or domains by default. As a result:

listitem.para: Admins cannot perform identity management using the dashboard
Any users created by an Admin using an authentication token from the v3 endpoint will not be able to log in to the dashboard.
The Keystone v3 endpoint is in the format: http://<host>:<port>/v3 and should be the internal URL. The cloud configuration files will have the endpoint for the v2 endpoint by default.

section.para: To use Keystone v3 in the dashboard (perhaps to use LDAP), you can manually change the settings using the steps below. When Keystone v3 is enabled, all user, project, and domain management must be done via the CLI. The Identity panel will not be visible in the dashboard.
Steps to switch Horizon from Keystone v2 to Keystone v3 are:

listitem.para: Log in to the lifecycle manager.
Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/config/horizon/local_settings.py file and make the following changes:
Change the OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_MULTIDOMAIN_SUPPORT value to True:
Change the OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL value to your Keystone v3 endpoint:

listitem.screen: git add -A git commit -a -m "configure Horizon to use Keystone v3"
